conclusion: Consider principles of shadow formation and effect of light source position.
The image shows four objects with shadows labeled A, B, C, and D.
Initial position of light source casts shadows A, B, C, and D.
Light source moves forward, directly above the objects.
Shadows become shorter as light rays are more directly overhead.
Shadows shift slightly backward, directly under the objects.
Size of shadows decreases, making them more compact.
Shadow A moves backward and becomes shorter.
Shadow B moves backward and becomes shorter.
Shadow C moves backward and becomes shorter.
Shadow D moves backward and becomes shorter.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D become shorter and shift slightly backward.
